Hi Darcy,

There is no problem submitting such blades and sorry we missed y=
ou at  
the shinsa.

Gordon

On Sep 6, 2006, at 1:40 PM, samurai@... =
wrote:

> <robsongo@...> writes:
>
> > Had a good time. Enjoyed seein=
g lots of familiar faces and some good
> > swords. People are still submitt=
ing stuff they shouldn't, however. I
> > do hope the level of study continu=
es to improve. A lot of the guys
> > who have been with this for some time =
now did very well with some
> > only getting one or two rejections. Nonethe=
less, the younger and  
> less
> > experienced guys need some guidance. I t=
hink the clubs are best for
> > that. Still, when the front desk tells you =
not to submit your
> > numbered and stamped gunto and you do anyway, I gues=
s there is not
> > much that can be done. We are trying to have a traveling=
 shinsa  
> every
> > year with Chicago up next. I hope we can continue to =
see fewer
> > rejections. Oh, the show also seems to have been well attende=
d on
> > Saturday. I gave a short talk similar to the one in San Francisco,=

> > and it was a pretty good turn out for a one off event.
>
> > Gordon
>
=
> I was not able to make it for the show and had two swords I was  
> going=
 to
> submit for shinsa. One already had NBTHK attribution at Juyo level an=
d
> as it was a mumei, I was interested in alternate attributions.
>
> As I=
 didn't make it, neither were submitted.
>
> Does the NTHK accept such blad=
es? I was told somewhat vaguely that  
> they
> may not so I would like to =
know if I should bother submitting things
> like this in the future?
>
> Th=
anks,
>
> - darcy
